It is the job of another constraint to make sure overlapping shifts do not happen.

It would seem that you do not need the join with the MinMaxContractLine.
The same could possibly be done with ifExists(...) after from(Employee.class).
This has the potential to speed up things quite a bit.

It is questionable if you even need the Employee join. You can read the employee from the ShiftAssignment directly.
Another potential perf improvement.
The improvements to this constraint are probably also applicable to other constraints in this class.
Please take care to maintain proper indentation, the filtrers and penalties ought to start at the same column. This is just one instance of multiple of this problem.
Please remove the use of BiTuple here.

Instead of the many joins and the mapping, wouldn't it be better to just group by employee+shiftType on the shift assignment directly?
Quad joins will be very expensive on their own, we should try to avoid them as much as possible.
